    • Method Detail

      • seed

        public static void seed(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
        java.lang.String eventName)
        Updates player skills matching the given event name string. Additionally, events seeded here can both trigger and interrupt Perk effects on a player, if configured to do so in the associated PerkDefinition.

        Event strings are a space-separated list of event categories that should gain granularity for each token, as read left-to-right. As an example, the event "block break minecraft:dirt" will seed skills matching both "block break" and "block", as well as an exact match to all three tokens. Keep in mind that individual tokens must not contain spaces - it is recommended to use valid slug names when possible. See TextUtil.slugify(String) for a utility that can aid in this. Note that all string comparisons are case insensitive.

        Event names passed to this method may optionally include special seed matcher strings. These strings allow more advanced matching to take place for specially-notated event strings. For example, an event token !class:java.lang.String will match against both java.lang.String and its parent classes, such as java.lang.CharSequence. Additional matcher tags may be defined in the SkillSeedMatcherRegistry, if desired.

        Third-party mods are welcome to use this method to add additional seed events to the Skillful mod. To do so, simply pass an event string to this method along with the relevant player. It is recommended that you use a consistent event hierarchy and prefix it with a logical namespace. For example, a custom event from your mod might be: "my-mod-id some-event-type some-parameter". See the above paragraphs for more information on event string requirements.

        Note that the actual amount that the skill increases by is configured by end-users - actual event seeds should not have an implicit value.

        This method will dispatch cancelable SkillfulProgressEvent instances as well as SkillfulLevelUpEvent instances to the Forge event bus, MinecraftForge.EVENT_BUS, when relevant.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context. If called with a client-side player, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        player - the player whose skills should be updated
        eventName - the name of the event to seed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when called from a client context
